solution_02_probability/01_overview/q3_comb_v1

video

This scenario describes a combinations problem (order does not matter). We are considering the subsets of size 5 from a set of size 11.

\[\begin{aligned} {_nC_r} &= \frac{n!}{(n-r)! \cdot r!} \\\\ n &= 11 \\\\ r &= 5 \\\\ {_{11}C_{5}} &= \frac{11!}{(11-5)!\cdot 5! } \\\\ &= \frac{11!}{6! \cdot 5!} \\\\ &= \frac{ 11\cdot10\cdot9\cdot8\cdot7}{ 5\cdot4\cdot3\cdot2\cdot1} \\\\ &= 462 \end{aligned}\]
